item.title: JUPAR: Updating Java desktop applications made easy!
Some retro technology! ZX Spectrum
item.description: The first computer I've used and I remember (8-bit game consoles don't count) was a *386* running *MS-DOS* and *Windows 3.1*. However, before that my parents have got a very cool computer! That was a *Sinclair's ZX Spectrum*.

item.title: Java: A simple and neat cli Progress Bar
item.description: Back on June c00kiemon5ter wrote a cli progress bar in java. As it seems it isn't something difficult but I find it pretty usefull and worth to be mentioned. The progress bar was originally written as part of F.I.C.

item.title: Trackable File Distribution - a simple approach
item.description: Let's asume that we have a community or something that distributes material such as pictures, pdf's e.t.c. by a website to it's registered only users. If the _management_ wants only the registered members to download the material is it possible to somehow track a member who leaks something in another public mean such as uploading it to a public place or redistributing it via torrents?

item.title: PHP: Protect the c0d3
item.description:
Protecting the PHP code I wrote has passed my mind in the past but never actually bothered me because the code I have wrote was either open source or hosted in a self-administrated enviroment.
Anyway, as it seems many people are interested in protecting their code from distribution without their permission.

item.title: Give a smile: Become a blood donor!
item.description: This article is about http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blood_donation[blood donation]. I will present you my view as a blood donor and try to point you out why you should become a blood donor yourself if you fill the requirements.

item.title: Hello World AsciiBlog :)
item.description: Bellow I will explain you the logic behind Asciiblog, the workflow of the blogging process and I'll point out some features that are missing and I would like to implement in the future.
